resources.string: The displayed rain volume is the cumulative amount of rain for the remainder of today. One millimetre of rain is equivalent to one litre of water over an area of one square metre.

The Beaufort Scale classifies wind speeds into observable and relatable conditions :
 • Below 1 km/h - Calm
 • Below 6 km/h - Light Air
 • Below 12 km/h - Light Breeze
 • Below 20 km/h - Gentle Breeze
 • Below 29 km/h - Moderate Breeze
 • Below 39 km/h - Fresh Breeze
 • Below 50 km/h - Strong Breeze
 • Below 62 km/h - Moderate Gale
 • Below 75 km/h - Fresh Gale
 • Below 89 km/h - Strong Gale
 • Below 103 km/h - Whole Gale
 • Below 118 km/h - Storm
 • Above 118 km/h - Hurricane
The Beaufort Scale classifies wind speeds into observable and relatable conditions. Click Know More to access the Wikipedia page for proper information about each wind speed level.
The UV Index is a linear scale to measure strength of the ultraviolet radiations that can cause sunburns. Click More Info to know more about what each level indicates.
Feel that the location determined by the app is inaccurate? Or is the app not able to find your location at all? You can force update the location.
